context: The Estonian verb 'näidata' means to show, demonstrate or display something. It is a regular -da ending verb in the infinitive form and belongs to the I conjugation class. In present tense, it would be näitan (I show), näidad (you show), näitab (he/she/it shows), näitame (we show), näitate (you [pl.] show), näitavad (they show). The verb is used when presenting or revealing something to someone else.
